commentaire: I needed a bank I could trust, with an actual physical location to interact with. Not spending countless hours on the phone just to try to get my money; and they were there when needed. It is great to know some banks still value customer interaction and face to face transactions. In the age when people pretend to be other people, Meriwest provides me ample security, safety, and peace of mind in knowing they can’t be defrauded putting my money in safe hands.

I was an almost 30 year client of Meriwest until they upgraded their login system with minimal notification and locked my out of my account. After multiple attempts, I final sent a registered letter to close my account back in March, and have yet to get my money back (now May). They continue to send me e-notices even though I have told them multiple times I can't login (probably telling me about all the fees that they are charging me rather than giving my money back as requested). I suspect I am going to have to get a lawyer involved to get my money back from them.

Bottom line: I would bury my money in glass jars in the backyard before I would use Meriwest again. They certainly put profits ahead of customer satisfaction.

Titre: Beware of PNC credit card fraud and my experience
commentaire:
I wanted to make my experience public and let it be known that I have been a victim of credit card fraud with PNC and PNC doing absolutely nothing to take responsibility for this lapse in security.
I have been a dedicated PNC customer since 1972 with mortgages, business loans, business accounts and many others for more than 50 years,
When I received my October statement, I immediately spotted three charges that I did not make.
The three charges were all made October 11, 2024 in the state of Washington, with a total cost of approximately $40.
I immediately called the PNC fraud department to let them know that I did not make these charges.
I was told that my credit card was used to make these purchases and I would still be held responsible for these charges.
I then called a PNC branch manager where I live in Scottsdale, Arizona.
I was told that the incident would be referred back to the agent in the Philippines.
I let the manager know that nobody has ever had possession of my card.
In all the years I've done business with PNC, I was never once late on one payment and have never had a single issue.
I was shocked to find out that I am still being held responsible to pay for these charges that I did not make.
I have no faith in PNC at this point.
Will my card be used once again with fraudulent activity?
The worst part about this experience is that PNC accused me of lying and that I would still be held responsible for these fraudulent charges,
I will be posting my experience on every website and social media site I can find, to warn others of this terrible experience

Titre: PNC Bank - "Our Customer Is Our Adversary"
commentaire:
PNC Bank recently hired some Madison Avenue ad company to come up with their current marketing slogan "Brilliantly Boring since 1865." In my opinion, a better slogan for this bank would have been "Our Customer Is Our Adversary." Ever since taking over BBVA bank out here on the West Coast in 2021, PNC's heavy-handed and authoritarian manner during this time led to an unsurprising mass exodus of BBVA customers. I should have been one of them. Over the past three years, this "boring" bank has proven its disrespectful, adversarial treatment of its customers over and over again. God forbid your account ever becomes overdrawn - PNC bank allows only ONE overdraft item per year.
Recently, a government debit that was applied to my account several weeks early resulted in an overdraft situation. Over the following days, my account was consistently charged $36 per item, to cover multiple merchant processing fees as small as 13, 39 and 52 cents each. This resulted in 18 overdraft charges - a total of $648 removed from my account. PNC's 'customer service' will not even address this issue, and I was informed again of their 'one overdraft allowed per year' rule.
During this time, not one bank manager or representative reached out to enquire if they could assist in any way. This bank's adversarial behavior and almost derisive treatment of customers will not sustain itself for much longer in California. The two branches near me are pitifully empty most of the time, except for the unfortunate 'bored' people who work there. Stay away from PNC bank - they are without a doubt the most singularly unhelpful, arrogant and adversarial bank I have ever dealt with.
